page.title: 10 FARMING
page.content: Long Sutton is an agricultural area which has lots of deep rich soil. The fields which are all flat have dykes surrounding them to drain the water away. There are no hedges and few trees. The land is always being worked and there are many allotments and glasshouses. There is not much livestock, but there is a wide range of crops. Some of the food crops are wheat, barley, potatoes and sugar beet. There are some new crops in Long Sutton like oil seed rape and roses. Soft fruit is grown in Long Sutton to be sold to either the fresh market or the canning factory. We grow daffodils and tulips in Long Sutton for the flowers and the bulbs. We grow salad crops, both under glass and in the open.
